fields.description:
In the current FECRU REST API (https://docs.atlassian.com/fisheye-crucible/latest/wadl/fecru.html) I cannot find a method to add a repository to a project.

This has to be done by a form right now, which uses a form token. This makes it very hard to use programmatically.

Hence it would be nice to be able to have a repository resource under the projects resource, where we can POST or PUT repositories (as well as DELETE them).
fields.summary: Add REST API for addPathToFisheyeProject

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The "Include/Exclude Paths" section (both repository defaults and individual repository) can be very confusing when it comes to getting the correct patterns defined for indexing and can lead to "missing revisions" or "excluded files" errors in the logs. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Have a link to the CAC guides from the application "Include/Exclude Paths" screens :
https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/include-exclude-paths-298976903.html
https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/pattern-matching-guide-298976797.html
to help give the users a reference point.
fields.summary: Add a link to include/exclude and patterns CAC page

fields.description: Currently FishEye only supports JKS keystores. I have all my other Atlassian products configured to use PKCS12 directly which simplifies life across the board. This allows consistent keystore locations on all servers as well as a common connector statement in all configs. This would be a huge enhancement for ease of integration and support
fields.summary: Add direct support for PKCS12 certs

fields.description:
At the moment ssh wrapper (fe-git.sh or fe-git.bat) is used only when there are ssh credentials configured on the repository.  When they are not set, git and mercurial would still attempt to use OS user configured keys, but ssh wrapper won't be used.
It seems like no harm to use ssh wrapper always, that would enforce for instance BatchMode option to be enabled.
Note ssh wrapper is passed to git and mercurial executables as an option how to run ssh, so if ssh is not required (accessing repository by file protocol for instance) it should be simply ignored, it shouldn't cause any performance penalty.
fields.summary: use ssh wrapper for all git/hg commands

fields.description:
Even having [Exclude Paths|https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/include-exclude-paths-298976903.html] configured, FishEye may attempt to load the paths into memory.  This can lead to OOME in case there is a huge number of paths under excluded folders.

For instance, having repository like:
{noformat}
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r6 | piotrs | 2015-08-27 16:32:20 +0200 (Thu, 27 Aug 2015) | 2 lines
Changed paths:
   M /xxxGroup/xxx/tags/tag_1.0.0/file.txt

changed file on a tag

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r5 | piotrs | 2015-08-27 11:30:27 +0200 (Thu, 27 Aug 2015) | 2 lines
Changed paths:
   A /xxxGroup/xxx (from /xxx:4)

copied xxx project

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r4 | piotrs | 2015-08-27 11:30:00 +0200 (Thu, 27 Aug 2015) | 1 line
Changed paths:
   A /xxxGroup

xxxGroup created
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r3 | piotrs | 2015-08-27 11:29:43 +0200 (Thu, 27 Aug 2015) | 2 lines
Changed paths:
   A /xxx/tags/tag_1.0.0 (from /xxx/trunk:2)

tag 1.0.0

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r2 | piotrs | 2015-08-27 11:29:22 +0200 (Thu, 27 Aug 2015) | 1 line
Changed paths:
   A /xxx/trunk/file.txt

file.txt
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r1 | piotrs | 2015-08-27 11:29:06 +0200 (Thu, 27 Aug 2015) | 1 line
Changed paths:
   A /xxx
   A /xxx/branches
   A /xxx/tags
   A /xxx/trunk

init
------------------------------------------------------------------------
{noformat}

and repository configured with:
* base repository path: {{xxxGroup}}
* exclude path: {{xxx/tags/*}}

the path {{/xxxGroup/xxx/tags/tag_1.0.0/file.txt}} will be loaded into infoMap at Svn2Infill2Processor#getInfo method.
fields.summary: SVN excluded paths are loaded into memory when indexing what can cause OutOfMemoryError

fields.description:
Apparently when Start revision is set and initial import is set to "No initial import", FishEye may crash with OutOfMemoryError with large repositories (with a huge number of files at the start-rev revision).

FE-4773 fixed the issue for repositories where repository path (Repository Config / SCM Details / SVN Connection Details / Path) is empty, but when it is not empty FishEye would still attempt to do initial import.
fields.summary: OutOfMemoryError when Start Revision, Initial Import: "No initial import" and repository path are set

fields.description:
It would be much more flexible if any reverse proxy related configuration got set outside Fecru itself via de facto http headers instead of inside (proxy host, scheme and port) like:
- X-Forwarded-Host
- X-Forwarded-Server
- X-Forwarded-For
- X-Real-IP
- X-Forwarded-Proto
- X-Forwarded-Port

You guys already use it some way as defined in the page for configuring Stash with nginx (https://confluence.atlassian.com/stash/securing-stash-behind-nginx-using-ssl-416583028.html)

Relates to FE-5757
fields.summary: Use de facto standard http headers for reverse proxy

# Create an Application Link from JIRA to FishEye.
# Navigate to JIRA Dashboard and edit the Activity Stream gadget.
# Note the option to include the Crucible stream is also available:!2015-05-27_1647.png|thumbnail!

fields.summary: Activity Stream gadget displays both FishEye + Crucible products as stream options regardless of license

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The _Allow 2-Legged OAuth_ link in the app links pop up dialogue leads to a dead link;

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set ip up application link
# Edit the application link
# Follow the link on Outgoing Authentication > OAuth tab

!Screen Shot 2015-08-17 at 11.33.20.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Result
The user is directed to https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/APPLINKS/Configuring+OAuth+Authentication+for+an+Application+Link instead.

h3. Actual Result

The user is directed to https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE038/Configuring+OAuth+Authentication+for+an+Application+Link


h3. Notes
On the older versions this looks like it should be https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE034/Configuring+OAuth+Authentication+for+an+Application+Link - with the version number replaced with the appropriate one

There is also no mention of the use of 2-legged OAuth or 2-legged OAuth with Impersonation on this page - [Configuring OAuth Authentication for an Application Link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/APPLINKS/Configuring+OAuth+Authentication+for+an+Application+Link], this does appear to be present on the following documentation though - [Configuring Authentication for an Application Link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/APPLINKS/Configuring+Authentication+for+an+Application+Link].
fields.summary: Dead Link for Allow 2-Legged OAuth in FishEye Crucible

fields.description:
h4. Steps to repro:

1. Setup JIRA and FeCru and applink the two of them
2. Create an issue, and a review.
3. Put a No open reviews condition in the workflow.
4. Put the issue key in the objectives portion of the review.

h4. Expected
You can transition the issue since this field in Crucible has nothing to do with the Development Panel and since the Crucible data isn't reflected in JIRA it should not have an effect on the workflow.

h4. Actual
The transition is not available.
fields.summary: No open reviews condition incorrectly checks Crucible's "Objectives" field for issue key

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

It would be beneficial for Pull Requests and their comments to be able to be able to be exported over to Crucible. This will enable the management of stash review comments in Crucible and allow for further adhoc reviews built on top of what has already in place from the pull request.

fields.description:
In FishEye I can look at an individuals statistics. When searching for a person, I can see the full list of people in my organization. What I would like to do would be look at a much smaller subset, specifically people on my team.

So the Fisheye AllUsers page, with its list of statistics, would look the same but just list the five or six names of the people on my team. Even if I cannot do that, I would like to create a page where I can pull up comparisons between team members.

I previously posted this question to the Atlassian Answers page.
[https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/22654823/answers/23760627]
fields.summary: Allow Comparison of Team Member Output

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the application is starting up, the Spring context starts, but the review indexer is started afterwards. (see Run#mainImpl()).
Requests that use the indexer will return with a 'Indexer is stopped' error before that happens (which should usually be a few seconds at most).

h3. Expected Results
The indexer starts as a part of the Spring context startup, and no errors are logged

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-fisheye-YYYY-MM-DD.log}} file:
{noformat}
2016-02-26 12:03:20,000 ERROR [qtp458872080-139 ] fisheye TotalityFilter-logExceptionDetails - Exception "Indexer is stopped (com.atlassian.crucible.activity.lucene.DefaultReviewItemIndexer@56a5e7fb)" (java.lang.IllegalStateException) while processing "/rest/remote-link-aggregation/latest/aggregation" (Referer:"null")
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Indexer is stopped (com.atlassian.crucible.activity.lucene.DefaultReviewItemIndexer@56a5e7fb)
	at com.atlassian.crucible.activity.lucene.DefaultReviewItemIndexer.checkStatus(DefaultReviewItemIndexer.java:374)
	at com.atlassian.crucible.activity.lucene.DefaultReviewItemIndexer.withIndexSearcher(DefaultReviewItemIndexer.java:745)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
{noformat}

The stacktrace above appears after the +Spring context start+:
{noformat}
2016-02-26 12:03:10,000 INFO  [main ] org.eclipse.jetty.server.Server Server-doStart - jetty-8.1.10.v20130312
2016-02-26 12:03:10,001 INFO  [main ] / ContextHandler$Context-log - Initializing Spring root WebApplicationContext
{noformat}

And the +Review indexer start+:
{noformat}
2016-02-26 12:03:20,000 INFO  [main ] fisheye Run-mainImpl - Server started on :8060 (http) (control port on 127.0.0.1:8059)
2016-02-26 12:03:20,001 INFO  [qtp458872080-137 ] com.sun.jersey.server.impl.application.WebApplicationImpl WebApplicationImpl-_initiate - Initiating Jersey application, version 'Jersey: 1.8-atlassian-14 04/30/2014 06:01 PM'
2016-02-26 12:03:20,002 INFO  [qtp458872080-137 ] com.sun.jersey.server.impl.application.WebApplicationImpl WebApplicationImpl-_initiate - Initiating Jersey application, version 'Jersey: 1.8-atlassian-14 04/30/2014 06:01 PM
{noformat}

h3. Notes
The error can be safely ignored.
It only occurs if a request using the indexer is triggered, so it may not be available after every start of the application.
fields.summary: Review indexer should be started as a part of the context startup, not afterwards to avoid race conditions
Spring warning about incosistent constructor declaration for hostContextAccessor

fields.description:
If an exception occurs when waiting for a healthcheck (in DefaultHealthCheckRunner#runChecks), the exception is added as a healthcheck result, that potentially is shown in the admin banner:

We should probably just log it.

Moreover the activity stream provider may be called multiple times when it is unable to provide number of items equal to requested {{maxItems}} (eg. because the list was filtered out by permissions) and each next call requests 3x more items.

Possible solutions:
* eliminate multiple transactions as they trigger Hibernate dirty flush
* apply permissions to first query - do not apply permissions in second step

Problem may be visible to each provider which implements {{CoalescingActivityItemProviderBase.getMoreActivityItems()}}.
fields.summary: LuceneReviewStateChangeActivityItemProvider spends a lot of time on Hibernate dirty checking

fields.description:
When viewing the source of a file in Fisheye there is no way to toggle the vertical menus on the left panel. The user can only collapse them as far as the controls allow currently. Because of this, a lot of horizontal scrolling is necessary to read the entire length of longer lines of code. It would be nice to have a way of seeing the full source file (horizontally) without having to scroll across so much. An example capability would be the ability to toggle with (Shift + t ) when looking at reviews in Crucible. 

To replicate: simply navigate to the file that you wish to view using the navigation tree on the left. When you have selected that file, click the "Source" button at the top left of the page. You will see that a scroll bar appears at the bottom of the file. If you attempt to collapse the columns to the left of the file, you are only able to minimally.
fields.summary: Addition of a Toggle Button When Viewing Source Files

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Whenever a workflow has a condition based on an application link (e.g. Code Committed Condition, No Open Reviews Condition, Unreviewed Code Condition), the condition will be bypassed if the user is not currently authenticated to the other application

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a condition to verify another application to a transition
# Make sure the user attempting the workflow transition is not connected to the other application

h3. Expected Results
Transition is not available as it cannot confirm the condition passes

h3. Actual Results
Transition is available and transitions without problems.
The following is logged
{noformat}
2015-07-08 15:34:15,819 http-bio-8080-exec-13 ERROR petry 934x4530x1 4becn9 192.168.10.136 /browse/TC-1 [domain.workflow.condition.ReviewsCompleteCondition] Error retrieving reviews for ReviewsCompleteCondition (TC-1). Enable logging for the FishEye plugin for more detail.
{noformat}
fields.summary: Fisheye Plugin Workflow Conditions based on applink bypassed when user is not authenticated to other application

fields.description:
From the page http://jdbc.postgresql.org/download.html :
{quote}
If you are using the 1.6 then you should use the JDBC4 version. If you are using 1.7 or 1.8 then you should use the JDBC41 version.
{quote}
Since FeCru 3.8,  Java 8 is supported, but we still ship with PostgreSQL 9.3 JDBC4 and 8.4 JDBC3

h3.Workaround
Download the JDBC41 driver from http://jdbc.postgresql.org/download.html and replace the existing postgreSQL driver in _$FeCru/lib/dbdrivers/postgresql/_
fields.summary: FeCru is shipped with Postgres JDBC4 and JDBC3 instead of JDBC41

fields.description:
We have a few documents talking about Project Links, and I'd like to suggest some changes to them, in order to explain in more details the current benefits you get for having a Project Link created. I though about this suggestion as I think there are some observed benefits which are not listed, or not completely listed in these documents. I'll refer to these documents as follows, so it's easier to reference them in my description:

* AppLinks Project Links: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/APPLINKS/Creating+Links+Between+Projects]
* FishEye Project Links: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Linking+FishEye+to+JIRA]
* Crucible Project Links: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Linking+Crucible+to+JIRA]

I'll enumerate the things I observed, so it's also easier to refer to them and where I observed them or not in these docs:
# The Project Link between a JIRA project and a FishEye repository and/or a Crucible project restricts the scope of the Activity Stream in JIRA, i.e. if I link my JIRA project to my FishEye repository, then creates an Activity Stream specifically for this JIRA project it will only display commits from the linked FishEye project, whereas if no FishEye repository is linked, the Activity Stream is going to show information from any FishEye repository.
# A link between a JIRA project and a Crucible project will make with, when a user creates a review for a commit in FishEye from the JIRA issue, the popup to select the Crucible project in which the review will be created comes already filled with the linked Crucible project. This is actually a convenience for some users, so they don't have to select the Crucible project every time.

Below I'm describing which of the above I see in each of these docs or not:
* The AppLinks Project Links doc has a brief example of the benefit 1, describing an example between JIRA and Confluence. Benefit 2 isn't mentioned. I thought it would be good to let clear to the customers they could also achieve both benefits, but I understand this specific page may not be intended to enter in many details about each of the apps, as it is a general doc for AppLinks, so maybe this information should be left to the pages specific to each product.
* The FishEye Project Links doc mentions, under the *Project links* section, what seems to be a summary of the benefit 1, but I think it's not very clear on how the user can achieve it.
* The Crucible Project Links doc doesn't mention benefit 2 at all, so I think it could be included.
* I also noticed neither of the FishEye or Crucible Project Links docs are linked to the AppLinks Project Links doc, so I think it would make sense if they were linked (i.e. if the AppLinks Project Links doc offer links to the other two docs).

Please let me know if any further detail is needed.
fields.summary: Improve Project Links documentation

fields.description:
We're using the Directory Scanning Plugin to automatically add newly created repos from remote (mounted locally) bare Git repos.

One thing I've noticed is that the repos are simply named whatever the actual bare repo is called. Our Git server organizes everything in git/project/repo.git. Given the number of repos we have, we're getting duplicate repos name x.git showing up in FishEye. This is causing a fair amount of confusion.

We'd like an option to have the DS Plugin add the project name to the repo name upon discovery. For example git/angrynerds/eggs.git would be named angrynerds_eggs.git instead of just eggs.git in FishEye.
fields.summary: Directory Scanning Plugin - Option to include project in repo name.

fields.description:
pom.xml files for Maven releases prior to Fecru 3.8 were complete and contained all the metadata, including entire list of dependencies. Here is an example of pom.xml from Maven release 3.7.0-20150127093303:

https://maven.atlassian.com/service/local/repositories/atlassian-public/content/com/atlassian/fisheye/fisheye-jar/3.7.0-20150127093303/fisheye-jar-3.7.0-20150127093303.pom
{code}
<project>
  <parent>
    <groupId>com.atlassian.fisheye</groupId>
    <artifactId>atlassian-fisheye-root</artifactId>
    <version>3.7.0-20150127093303</version>
    <relativePath>../../pom.xml</relativePath>
  </parent>
  <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
  <artifactId>fisheye-jar</artifactId>
  <packaging>jar</packaging>
  <dependencies>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>com.atlassian.fisheye</groupId>
      <artifactId>atlassian-fisheye-dependencies</artifactId>
      <type>pom</type>
    </dependency>
    <!--
     the fisheye-api is not a dependency of the main fisheye pom, because it is built from source in the
                fisheye project as part of the fisheye build, but fisheye-jar does depend on it. 
    -->
    <dependency>
      <groupId>com.atlassian.fisheye</groupId>
      <artifactId>atlassian-fisheye-api</artifactId>
    </dependency>
  </dependencies>
  <build>
    <plugins>
      <plugin>
        <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
        <artifactId>maven-deploy-plugin</artifactId>
        <configuration>
          <packaging>jar</packaging>
        </configuration>
      </plugin>
    </plugins>
  </build>
</project>
{code}

Or, another example: https://maven.atlassian.com/service/local/repositories/atlassian-public/content/com/atlassian/fisheye/atlassian-fisheye-api/3.7.0-20150127093303/atlassian-fisheye-api-3.7.0-20150127093303.pom

  </dependencies>
  <build>
    <plugins>
      <plugin>
        <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
        <configuration>
          <source>${source.level}</source>
          <target>${source.level}</target>

</project>
{code}

fields.description: Backup procedure would overwrite existing backup file if provided name points to existing file.    Perhaps it should fail with descriptive error message, damaging existing backup files might be dangerous.
fields.summary: backup overwrites existing backup file if non unique backup file name provided

fields.description:
When scanning SVN repositories, a lot of time is taken in "expanding paths" for a commit. This seems to be done using {{svn diff --summarize}} to get all the changed paths in a revision.

However, many revisions (e.g. creating or removing tags or branches) just involve simple directory copies or deletions.

Would it be possible to optimize this process by looking at the {{svn log -v}} output for the revision, and when it includes a deletion or a copy-from-path addition, simply using the paths from the previous revision? This could avoid a long diff request.
fields.summary: Avoid Expanding Paths by using data from previous revision

fields.description:
h4. Problem
The currently widely used IPv4 address pool is close to exhaustion: [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IPv4_address_exhaustion]. IPv6 is around already for a while, however parts of our products may (and do) break.

h4. Requirement
- Add IPv6 tests for products and clarify it being supported for all parts of the products (external system connectivity, applinks, self-naming, reverse-proxying, etc).
- Update the supported platforms documentation and explicitly specify IPv6 to be supported to avoid confusion and give support a reference point.
fields.summary: Support for IPv6
JIRA no longer shows "Reviews" for Issues linked in review's Objectives

fields.description:
If SCM (in this case - mercurial) produces output in different locale than english we are not able to parse it and logging INFO message like this
{noformat}
INFO  [30278:StdOutHandler XXX ] fisheye BaseLineOutputHandler-reportNonMatchingLine - Non-matching line 'XXXXXXXX               12146:228460ff45fe (geschlossen)' context '[--config, ui.verbose=false, branches, -c]'
{noformat}

As a result of this "error" the exception might be thrown
{noformat}
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Both branchInCache and branchInScm not specified in onBranchHeadUpdated
	at com.atlassian.fisheye.hg.HgScanner.prepareBranchToBeStored(HgScanner.java:860)
	at com.atlassian.fisheye.dvcs.DvcsScanner.updateBranchHead(DvcsScanner.java:220)
	at com.atlassian.fisheye.dvcs.DvcsScanner.processRevisions(DvcsScanner.java:296)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.LifecycleRepositoryScanner.slurpRepository(LifecycleRepositoryScanner.java:82)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.LifecycleRepositoryScanner.doSlurpTransaction(LifecycleRepositoryScanner.java:49)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.BaseRepositoryScanner.ping(BaseRepositoryScanner.java:73)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.BaseRepositoryEngine.doSlurp(BaseRepositoryEngine.java:86)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryEngine.slurp(RepositoryEngine.java:414)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.ping.IndexingPingRequest.doRequest(IndexingPingRequest.java:27)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.ping.IncrementalPingRequest.doRequest(IncrementalPingRequest.java:30)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.ping.PingRequest$1.run(PingRequest.java:55)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.util.NamedExecution.run(NamedExecution.java:27)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.ping.PingRequest.process(PingRequest.java:52)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryHandle.processPingRequests(RepositoryHandle.java:217)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryHandle.access$100(RepositoryHandle.java:59)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryHandle$2.run(RepositoryHandle.java:173)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:724)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

h4. Workaround #1
Change locale of your fisheye user to english by putting the following line in .bashrc of Fisheye user.
{code}
export LANGUAGE=en_US
{code}
rerun .bashrc
{code}
. ~/.bashrc
{code}
and restart FishEye/Crucible instance


h4. Workaround #2

Use the attached [^noThrow.btm] Byteman script to force Fisheye ignore the error and continue indexing. Disable it afterwards. See [https://confluence.atlassian.com/fishkb/enable-byteman-for-additional-logging-in-fisheye-and-crucible-943956769.html].
fields.summary: Fisheye cannot parse SCM output in different locale than english

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When re-creating a user that has previously been deleted, the watches the user had set up before deletion are not maintained.

h3. Suggested Solution
Maintain watches in place after the user deletion and re-enable them in case of user re-creation. 
In this way the user doesn't have to manually re-add all the watches again.
fields.summary: Maintain watches list after recreating a deleted user

fields.description:
Add the ability to disable/enable the watches feature for a specific user - currently this can only be set for specific repositories.

Use case - employee is going on leave and has set up an Out of office reply, this will then spam the FishEye mail server for every commit made in the watched repositories.
fields.summary: Add the ability to enable/disable watches for a specific user

fields.description:
Every time FishEye/Crucible instance is upgraded, the static content files are served from a folder of new name, generated as unique value for each FishEye/Crucible version.  E.g. /static/nqrk9o/2static/images/spinner-activity.gif

This is problematic in emails for example - when getting notifications of review activity for instance, emails contains links to static resources using prefix known to particular Crucible version.  If Crucible gets upgraded and user opens old email, static resources like images won't be shown.

FishEye/Crucible should honour old prefixes and still return same content as if the current prefix was used
fields.summary: static content accessed with old prefix should be still rendered

fields.description:
The Smart Commits settings (at {{FishEye Administration > Smart Commits}}) are automatically disabled by FishEye if you have any Git or Hg repository in place and upgrade or restart the application. Upon upgrading or restarting, FishEye detects these types of repos then disable these settings, so the user must re-enable them manually.

This may lead to confusion, as the user may not notice the smart commit feature was disabled.
The suggestion is to stop making this change when detecting a Git or Hg repository.
fields.summary: Smart commits get disabled after an upgrade/restart if a Git or Hg repository is detected

fields.description:
Currently the Activity Stream takes the name of the repository from the *Description* field instead of the *Name* field in FishEye/Crucible. This can be confusing sometimes when the description actually describes something instead of the name of the repository, i.e. when a repository is added from Stash to FishEye/Crucible, as per the following screenshot:
!activity1.png|thumbnail!

Furthermore if a repository doesn't have a description its name isn't shown in the Activity Stream, and it also doesn't provide a URL to the repository.

h4.Workaround
Go to {{FishEye/Crucible Administration > Repositories}}, open the repository configuration and, at {{SCM Details}} edit its description.
fields.summary: Activity Stream: get repository name from Name instead of Description

fields.description:
There is no validation in place to check for the current port in use for running the application before allowing the same port to be used in the "AJP13 Bind" field on the "Server Settings" screen.

The config will be saved but the next time on application restart, it will fail with the following error:
{noformat}
2015-06-12 13:45:44,607 ERROR - Could not start server, one of the ports is taken: :8060 (http), :8060 (ajp13): Address already in use
java.net.BindException: Address already in use
	at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketBind(Native Method)
	at java.net.AbstractPlainSocketImpl.bind(AbstractPlainSocketImpl.java:382)
	at java.net.ServerSocket.bind(ServerSocket.java:375)
	at java.net.ServerSocket.<init>(ServerSocket.java:237)
	at java.net.ServerSocket.<init>(ServerSocket.java:181)
	at org.eclipse.jetty.server.bio.SocketConnector.newServerSocket(SocketConnector.java:96)
	at org.eclipse.jetty.server.bio.SocketConnector.open(SocketConnector.java:85)
	at org.eclipse.jetty.server.AbstractConnector.doStart(AbstractConnector.java:316)

	at org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.AbstractLifeCycle.start(AbstractLifeCycle.java:64)
	at org.eclipse.jetty.server.Server.doStart(Server.java:291)
	at org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.AbstractLifeCycle.start(AbstractLifeCycle.java:64)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.web.WebServer.start(WebServer.java:326)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.ctl.Run.mainImpl(Run.java:229)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.ctl.Run.main(Run.java:56)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)

fields.description:
Viewing diff on pom.xml on 338f39b changeset yields error, just click the diff icon on https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/changelog/stash?cs=338f39b7b16439da3974481872f5b5189d3bb3a6
It seems like this changeset is no longer in the history of https://stash.dev.internal.atlassian.com/projects/STASH/repos/stash/commits project, so I'm guessing this branch was abandoned or rebased to other changesets.  
This changeset is no longer in local clone on atlaseye, I'm guessing it was purged by gc automatically, note this change is 30 days old at the moment (git default prune period seems to be 2 weeks, see http://git-scm.com/docs/git-gc)

Please validate the gc is indeed causing such orphaned changesets to be removed from local clone.  Consider then changing local clone configuration by default to disable pruning of unreferenced objects completely.   Perhaps objects should only be pruned on full reindex, otherwise as long as the changesets live in infinityDB and Lucene indexes we clearly want to keep them in in the local clone.
fields.summary: garbage collection should be off for git repositories

fields.description:
The fisheye plugin does a synchronous HTTP request on view issue page loads that blocks the issue page from loading until it returns. This makes the entire view issue page performance rely on fisheye loading quickly.

Here's an example of a stack trace of a HTTP request timing out http://paste.internal.atlassian.com/view/16776.
fields.summary: ReviewsCompleteCondition degrades issue viewing performance.

fields.description:
Seen for git.
If a part of the blames comes from a revision that has been excluded, this might result in a NullPointerException, with a stack like:
{code}
java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.cenqua.fisheye.vis.BlameColourer.process(BlameColourer.java:37)
at com.cenqua.fisheye.vis.AgeBlameColourer.process(AgeBlameColourer.java:42)
at com.cenqua.fisheye.vis.AnnotationColourerFactory.create(AnnotationColourerFactory.java:33)
at com.cenqua.fisheye.web.ViewFileAction.doChart(ViewFileAction.java:560)
at com.cenqua.fisheye.web.ViewFileAction.handleFileRequest(ViewFileAction.java:216)
at com.cenqua.fisheye.web.ViewFileAction.handleRequest(ViewFileAction.java:145)
at com.cenqua.fisheye.web.BaseAction.processRequest(BaseAction.java:255)
at com.cenqua.fisheye.web.ActionDispatcherServlet.doIt(ActionDispatcherServlet.java:241)
at com.cenqua.fisheye.web.ActionDispatcherServlet.doGet(ActionDispatcherServlet.java:72)
at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:735)
{code}

The root cause is that the blame is saved with a revision==-1, when indexing. When retrieving the blame this is not handled, causing the error.

We should probably either create dummy revisions, handle the revision not being there, or fallback to SCM in this case.
fields.summary: Viewing files which have some blame from an excluded revision can resullt in a NullPointerException

fields.description:
When connecting via Application Links a FishEye and a Stash server in different machines, if the clocks are not synced, bugs like [this one|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/APL-1197] may occur. 

There were cases where 300 seconds of difference were enough to cause this bug, even causing problems to other application links.

I suggest the following changes:
* Showing a message, warning the clock difference, for a fast identification of the problem
* Software should be able to bypass small differences in clock

That would make troubleshooting easier and the software more reliable.
fields.summary: More graceful handling of clock difference in FishEye and Stash servers connected by Application Links

fields.description:
When the  'all branches and tags' setting is selected when building the directory tree, FileRevisions are loaded eagerly, when in fact only a few fields are needed. This causes potential slowdowns especially for directories with a lot of files.

fields.description:
When checking the reviews for a specific changeset (this is used in activity streams, changeset page, services used by the JIRA development panel, and the API), the getReviewsForChangeset() method traverses all revisions for the reviews. 

The number of revisions can be very large in some cases (especially for tag/branch commits in SVN), causing the method to execute very long.

Example stacks are:
{code}
...
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.impl.CommonRevInfoDAO$3.apply(CommonRevInfoDAO.java:2304)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.impl.CommonRevInfoDAO$3.apply(CommonRevInfoDAO.java:2298)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.impl.CommonRevInfoDAO.searchChangeSetRevids(CommonRevInfoDAO.java:320)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.impl.CommonRevInfoDAO.getReviewsForChangeset(CommonRevInfoDAO.java:2298)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RevidChangeSet.getReviewIds(RevidChangeSet.java:37)
...
{code}

Note: this can affect JIRA-FishEye dev status integration and cause timeouts on the Jira dev status panel. This can affect the performance of the following REST query:

{noformat}
/rest/dev-status/1.0/details/repositories?globalId=[ISSUE-KEY]
{noformat}
fields.summary: getReviewsForChangeset() can be very slow for large changesets

fields.description:
Apparently, when the textconv if configured in git client configuration (e.g. to show textual content diff between two Word documents), it may affect repository indexing.  In particular, when text converter fails with error repository indexing can't continue, see https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/15300297/answers/15302217

Perhaps FishEye should globally apply {{--no-textconv}} option to {{git diff}} command to disable such extensions explicitly.
fields.summary: ignore git client textconv settings when indexing git repositories

fields.description: When we create new Issues in Jira,  svn check-in references take up to 30 minutes to appear under the development heading.   Once they appear, subsequent check in references happen shortly after fisheye indexes the checkin.  Is there a configuration parameter that can be changed to speed up subversion commits for newly created Jira Issues?
fields.summary: subversion checkin latency from fisheye -> Jira.

fields.description:
Error still persists (see )


FishEye behaves strangely when indexing (SVN) files with non-printable characters in their filenames. The characters are converted as UTF and the indexing stops.

The following can be seen in the logs:
{noformat}
Sat May 09 20:33:17 MSK 2015: Repository paused due to error com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryClientException: org.apache.subversion.javahl.ClientException: svn: E170000: URL 'https://devserver/svn/R/VPNConnect%5Ctrunc' non-existent in revision 14 org.apache.subversion.javahl.ClientException: svn: E170000: URL 'https://devserver/svn/R/VPNConnect%5Ctrunc' non-existent in revision 14 org.tmatesoft.svn.core.SVNException: svn: E170000: URL 'https://devserver/svn/R/VPNConnect%5Ctrunc' non-existent in revision 14

Sun May 10 02:58:41 GMT+300 2015: Repository paused due to error com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryClientException: org.apache.subversion.javahl.ClientException: svn: E160013: '/svn/R/!svn/bc/700/FlexiHopper/dcn-ip/trunc/FlexiHopper%5Cdcn-ip%5Ctrunc' path not found: 404 Not Found (https://devserver)

Note "%5C" at the end of the filename.
fields.summary: FishEye SVN Indexing Fails When Filenames contain backslash

fields.description: After enabling Tarballs in a FishEye repository and saving it FishEye doesn't prompt for a restart, while it's necessary for the Download option to show up.
fields.summary: Enabling Tarballs doesn't prompt for a restart

fields.description:
At [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Repository+options] there's a note saying:

bq. Some changes will require the repository to be restarted, while others will require the repository to be re-indexed. FishEye will advise you if this is the case when you make the change. You can restart a repository from the 'Repositories' screen, by using the Restart function for the desired repository.

However, after setting Inlcude/Exclude Paths for Defaults and saving the settings the user doesn't receive a warn about restarting/re-indexing the repositories, so the changes aren't applied for existing repositories unless the user knows the repository needs to be restarted or re-indexed.
I also verified it doesn't ask for a restart on the repositories when setting a Hidden Directory.
fields.summary: Editing Repository Defaults doesn't warn about re-index or restart

fields.description:
Fisheye has enough dynamic HTML (or whatever technology) built into its pages that I find it mildly aggravating that I have to reload the review page to see my correct "% Reviewed" number in the Details Table's "Role" column.
Here's my experience:
# go to a review
# review all the files in the review
# go back to the details section to confirm I've reviewed all the files.  (Yes, I see that no files are listed in boldface in the repo tree any more, but I like to make sure I'm not missing anything.)
# _doh!_ I'm still at 0%.   I know I spent the past 1/2 hour doing something....
# reload the page
# Now I'm at 100%
:P
fields.summary: update user's "% Reviewed" value without requiring page reload.

fields.description:
*Current Limitation*
When creating a JIRA issue from Fisheye/Crucible, you are limited to default fields.

*Desired*
Ability to add extra fields to the create issue screen to populate the new JIRA issue.
fields.summary: Ability to Add Custom Fields to Create JIRA Issue Screen

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*:
# Integrate JIRA with Fisheye
# Create a Test Project with several issues in JIRA
# Connect Fisheye with a Repositories.
# Do a commit which mention some of the Test Project Issue Keys.
# Navigate to the Test Project Overview Page.
# Access the Source page and click on the statistic Tab.

*Expected Result:*
The commit statistic information about the project linked to will appear.

*Actual Result:*
Nothing is shown except a broken image icon and 404 Notfound error when accessing it with the browser Developer Tools open.

!statistictab.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA Project Source page Statistic Tab showing Broken Image and 404 Not Found error.

- Disable and enable the addon
- Restart FishEye/Crucible
